name: ll_3
probTex: Find the Laurent series of $f(z)=\frac{1}{(z-1)(z-2)}$ in the annulus $1<|z|<2$.
solnTex:
The partial fraction decomposition of the function becomes,
\[f(z)=\frac{-1}{z-1}+\frac{1}{z-2}=\frac{1}{1-z}-\frac{1}{2(1-\frac{z}{2})}\]
When $|z|>1$,
\[\frac{1}{1-z}=\frac{1}{z(1-\frac{1}{z})}\]
Therefore, the Laurent series is,
\[=\frac{1}{z(1-\frac{1}{z})}-\frac{1}{2(1-\frac{z}{2})}\]
\[=\frac{1}{z} \sum_{i=0}^{\infty} z^{-i}-\frac{1}{2} \sum_{i=0}^{\infty} 2^{-i} z^{i}\]
